claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.
explanation: A multi‐step schematic of the Flublok manufacturing process, showing PCR‐direct cloning of full‐length HA cDNA into a baculovirus (BV) expression vector, infection of insect cells in a bioreactor, harvest by disc‐stack centrifugation, extraction, depth filtration for clarification, capture and purification steps, DNA removal, and tangential flow filtration/formulation. does not support the claim because the figure only depicts the production workflow and contains no information on antigen dose comparisons or immunogenicity, and thus does not support the claim Note: None

detailed_analysis.image_description: A multi‐step schematic of the Flublok manufacturing process, showing PCR‐direct cloning of full‐length HA cDNA into a baculovirus (BV) expression vector, infection of insect cells in a bioreactor, harvest by disc‐stack centrifugation, extraction, depth filtration for clarification, capture and purification steps, DNA removal, and tangential flow filtration/formulation.
detailed_analysis.reasoning: does not support the claim because the figure only depicts the production workflow and contains no information on antigen dose comparisons or immunogenicity, and thus does not support the claim
